metadata.titleEn: Data set of background values of water, soil, atmosphere and biological environment in Namjagbarwa region (1983-1985)
metadata.description:
This data set comes from the book "natural geography and natural resources in the Namjagbarwa peak area", which is directed by Ren Meie, edited by Peng Buzhuo and Yang Yichou, and directed by the Institute of geography, Chinese Academy of Sciences. This book is one of the "mountaineering scientific investigation series" of Namjagbarwa peak. It is a comprehensive summary of the natural geographical research on Namjagbarwa peak and the great bend in the lower reaches of the Yarlung Zangbo River, which is a blank area in science.
Since the rivers in Nanfeng area are mostly turbulent, the evaporation and concentration effect is weak. In addition, in the humid Nanfeng area, the soil developed on gneiss is widely distributed, with strong leaching, poor soluble salt in the soil, and more acidic reaction. In order to analyze the contents of some anions and cations in natural water, some anions in different types of soils developed on gneiss parent materials at different altitudes in Nanfeng area were measured, and the results are listed in Table 3.
The content and distribution of elements in the soil are not only affected by the parent material of soil formation, but also related to the properties of organic matter and physical and chemical composition in the soil. Now the content of elements and physical and chemical composition of some soils developed in this area are listed in Table 8. It can be seen from table 8 that some elements are related to physical and chemical compositions such as organic matter and particle size. Nanfeng area has abundant rainfall, large plant coverage, and enhanced biological and chemical effects. There is a clear relationship between the accumulation of soil organic matter and the formation of clay particles and its height, that is, the lower the altitude, the stronger the biological and chemical weathering. At the same time, compared with Mount Everest, chemical weathering is also enhanced, which is the main reason why the content of other elements in the soil in this area is close to that of the world except Na, Mg and K.
The content of elements in soil is closely related to soil forming parent material and soil type. Now, the measured values of elements in main soil types and soil forming parent material are taken as the arithmetic mean, and the standard deviation is calculated, which is listed in Table 9. It can be seen from table 9 that there are certain differences in the content of elements in soils developed from different parent materials, and there are also considerable differences in the content of elements in different types of soils. It shows that the content of elements in soil is closely related to the parent material and soil type. This is mainly related to the chemical properties of the elements themselves and the geochemical properties of the elements in the process of soil formation.
The atmospheric aerosol samples of No. camp, base camp and Pai District in Nanfeng area were analyzed by PI Xe method. The measured values are listed in table 10 to explore the laws of transportation, diffusion, transformation and enrichment, carry out the research on the atmospheric background value in the clean area as soon as possible, and track the source of pollutants. Organic chlorinated compounds such as DDT, 666, PCB, due to their stable properties, can be affected by various natural factors in the environment and migrate for a long distance. In order to understand whether Nanfeng area is also polluted by this kind of organic chlorinated compounds, we used trace analysis method for the first time to analyze the content of organic chlorinated compounds in water, soil, animals and plants and other samples, so as to understand the biological background of Nanfeng area (tables 11, 12, 13), The content of DDT and 666 in water, soil, some plants and poultry eggs in Nanfeng area is very low, generally only 10-8 order of magnitude. No abnormality was found in the content levels of other elements in human hair and cattle hair samples collected.
The contents of inorganic substances in some biological samples from Nanfeng and Beijing are listed in table 14.
metadata.instructions:
3. Data details
The data set is stored in Excel format and contains 14 workbooks, including analysis method list, content of common anions and cations in snow and water in Nanfeng area, content of main anions in soil in Nanfeng area, background value of elements in water in Nanfeng area, content of trace elements in ice, snow and water in Nanfeng area, content of elements in soil in Nanfeng area (× 10-4), and content of main elements in soil in Nanfeng area The contents of elements in soil types, contents and physicochemical composition of soil in Nanfeng area, the contents of trace elements in soil types and weathering materials of soil forming parent rock in Nanfeng area, the results of atmospheric particulate matter measurement in Nanfeng area, the contents of 666, DDT and PCB in soil in Nanfeng area, the contents of 666, DDT and PCB in different plants in Nanfeng area, the contents of 666, DDT and PCB in different animals in Nanfeng area, and the contents of 666, DDT and PCB in Nanfeng area are all higher than those in other areas The contents of elements in human hair and cattle hair were determined.

Verification.Question: Are the data collection methods in the field of environmental background values of water, soil, atmosphere, and biological elements in the Nanga Parbat area standardized to include a wide range of altitudes?
Are trace analysis methods used for detecting organic chlorinated compounds in the environment a considered dataset collection technique in this field?

Disjunctive.Question: Is the data collection for studying the Nanga Parbat region's environmental background values more focused on atmospheric samples, soil analysis, or water chemistry?
Disjunctive.Answer: atmospheric samples, soil analysis, water chemistry

Disjunctive.Question: For assessing pollution levels in the Nanga Parbat region, are the methods more reliant on trace analysis of organic chlorinated compounds, physical aerosol sampling, or elemental analysis in biological samples?
Disjunctive.Answer: trace analysis of organic chlorinated compounds

Concept Completion.Question: What are the primary methods used to analyze the elemental content in soils within the 南迦巴瓦峰 region?
Where is the data on organic chlorine compounds in various samples from the 南迦巴瓦峰 region documented?

Example.Question: What is an example of a challenge encountered when collecting atmospheric aerosol samples in remote regions like 南迦巴瓦峰?
Example.Answer: An example of a challenge encountered in collecting atmospheric aerosol samples in remote regions like 南迦巴瓦峰 is understanding the transport, diffusion, transformation, and enrichment patterns of aerosol samples to establish atmospheric background values, which requires precise collection and analysis techniques.

Example.Question: Could you give an example of a dataset that illustrates the presence of organic chlorine compounds in the environment of 南迦巴瓦峰?
Example.Answer: An example of a dataset illustrating the presence of organic chlorine compounds in the environment of 南迦巴瓦峰 includes measurements of DDT and 666 concentrations in water, soil, and certain plant and animal samples, which were found to be very low, generally at the 10^-8 magnitude.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of soil elements influenced by parent material and soil type in the 南迦巴瓦峰地区?
Feature Specification.Answer: element content, distribution, variations in element concentrations, significant differences in element content

Feature Specification.Question: What specific attributes of the atmospheric aerosols are analyzed using the PI XE method in the 南迦巴瓦峰地区?
What factors are considered to analyze the presence of organic chlorine compounds in the environment in the 南迦巴瓦峰地区?
Feature Specification.Answer: stability, potential for long-distance migration, concentrations in water, soil, plants, animal samples

Quantification.Question: What is the concentration level of DDT and 666 found in water, soil, and biological samples from the 南迦巴瓦峰地区 region?
How many atmospheric aerosol samples were analyzed to study the transport, diffusion, transformation, and enrichment patterns in the 南迦巴瓦峰地区 region?
Quantification.Answer: The exact number of atmospheric aerosol samples is not specified.

Comparison.Question: How do the data collection methods for analyzing anion content in soils at different altitudes in the 南迦巴瓦峰 region compare to methods used for analyzing organic chlorine compounds in water and biological samples?
Comparison.Answer: The data collection methods for analyzing anion content in soils focus on measuring soil types at different altitudes specifically developed from gneiss parent material, while methods for analyzing organic chlorine compounds involve trace analysis techniques to assess their presence in water, soil, and biological samples. The former is centered on geochemical properties related to soil composition, whereas the latter targets potential pollution indicators in the environment.

Comparison.Question: What are the differences in the challenges faced when measuring atmospheric aerosol samples compared to measuring soil element distribution in the 南迦巴瓦峰 region?
Comparison.Answer: Measuring atmospheric aerosol samples involves understanding their transport, diffusion, transformation, and enrichment patterns to establish clean atmospheric background values and identify sources of pollutants. In contrast, measuring soil element distribution focuses on understanding the influence of parent material and soil type on element content, considering factors like organic matter and soil particle size, which are influenced by biological and chemical weathering processes.

Interpretation.Question: What can be inferred about the relationship between soil organic matter and elemental composition from the observed data on soil chemistry?
Interpretation.Answer: In the field, it is suggested that the elemental composition in soils is influenced by organic matter and the physical and chemical composition of the soil. The data indicates that certain elements correlate with organic matter content and particle size, affecting the distribution and concentration of elements in different soil types.

Interpretation.Question: What implications can be drawn about atmospheric pollution based on the analysis of organic chlorine compounds in environmental samples?
Interpretation.Answer: The data reveals that concentrations of organic chlorine compounds like DDT and 666 are generally low, indicating limited pollution from these substances in the region. The trace analysis method suggests that even stable compounds can be assessed for long-distance migration effects, providing insights into the region's pollution status and potential sources.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What are the underlying factors that influence the concentration of elements in the soil of the 南迦巴瓦峰 region, and how do these factors affect data collection methods?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The concentration of elements in the soil of the 南迦巴瓦峰 region is influenced by factors such as the parent material, soil type, organic matter content, and physical-chemical composition. These factors affect data collection methods by necessitating the measurement of various soil types and parent materials at different altitudes, as well as the analysis of organic matter and particle size to understand the chemical and biological processes at work.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What causes the variation in atmospheric aerosol composition in the 南迦巴瓦峰 region, and how does it impact the choice of technology for data collection?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The variation in atmospheric aerosol composition in the 南迦巴瓦峰 region is caused by factors such as transport, diffusion, transformation, and enrichment processes. This impacts the choice of technology for data collection by requiring methods like PIXE analysis to understand these processes and assess the atmospheric background values, which helps in tracing the sources of pollutants.

Causal Antecedent.Question: Why is there a need to analyze trace organic chlorine compounds in the 南迦巴瓦峰 region, and what challenges does this pose for data collection?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: There is a need to analyze trace organic chlorine compounds like DDT, 666, and PCB in the 南迦巴瓦峰 region to assess potential pollution and understand the biological background conditions. This poses challenges for data collection as these compounds are stable and can migrate over long distances, requiring sensitive trace analysis methods to detect low concentrations in various environmental samples such as water, soil, plants, and animal products.

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the potential outcomes of using different altitudes for soil sample collection on the analysis of anions in a dataset?
Causal Consequence.Answer: The potential outcomes include variations in the concentration of certain anions due to the influence of different altitudes on soil development and leaching processes. This can affect the analysis by reflecting altitude-specific chemical weathering and biological activity.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the purpose of analyzing the elemental content and physical-chemical composition of soils in different soil types within the Nanga Parbat region?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The analysis aims to understand how elemental content in the soil is influenced by soil parent material and soil type, and to explore the relationship between soil elements and organic matter as well as particle size, which can be affected by biological and chemical weathering processes in the region.

Goal Orientation.Question: Why is it important to analyze atmospheric aerosol samples using the PIXE method at various sites such as base camps in the Nanga Parbat region?
Goal Orientation.Answer: Analyzing atmospheric aerosol samples using the PIXE method is crucial to investigate the transport, diffusion, transformation, and enrichment patterns of these aerosols, which helps in researching the atmospheric background values in clean areas and tracking the sources of pollutants.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the goal of using trace analysis methods to assess the presence of organochlorine compounds in water, soil, and biological samples in the Nanga Parbat region?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The goal is to determine whether the Nanga Parbat region is affected by pollution from stable organochlorine compounds such as DDT, 666, and PCB, and to gain an understanding of the biological background conditions in the area.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What methodologies are utilized for measuring and analyzing the levels of inorganic and organic compounds in soil and water samples in the 南迦巴瓦峰地区 environment?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The methodologies include measuring the concentration of certain anions in different soil types at various altitudes and using trace analysis methods to determine the presence of organic chlorinated compounds like DDT and 666 in water, soil, and biological samples.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: How are atmospheric aerosol samples collected and analyzed to understand their transport, diffusion, transformation, and enrichment patterns in 南迦巴瓦峰地区?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: Atmospheric aerosol samples are analyzed using the PIXE method at various points such as camps and bases in 南迦巴瓦峰地区. This analysis helps to explore the transport, diffusion, transformation, and enrichment patterns of aerosols, facilitating research on atmospheric background values in clean areas and tracing pollutant sources.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures are followed to assess the chemical weathering process in soils developed on gneiss parent material at different altitudes in 南迦巴瓦峰地区?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The procedures involve analyzing the content and distribution of elements in soils, considering the influence of parent material, organic matter, and the physical-chemical composition of the soil. This includes comparing elemental content across different soil types and parent materials, and assessing the effects of biological and chemical weathering influenced by precipitation and vegetation coverage.

Enablement.Question: What methods enable the analysis of atmospheric aerosol samples to understand their transport, diffusion, transformation, and enrichment in the Nanga Parbat region?
Enablement.Answer: The use of PIXE (Particle Induced X-ray Emission) analysis on atmospheric aerosol samples at various points such as the base camp and other areas in the Nanga Parbat region allows for the exploration of their transport, diffusion, transformation, and enrichment patterns.

Expectation.Question: Why might data collection efforts in regions with rapid water flow and high precipitation, like the 南迦巴瓦峰地区, face unique challenges?
Expectation.Answer: The data collection in such regions can be challenging due to the rapid water flow, which diminishes evaporation concentration effects, and the high precipitation, which influences soil leaching and affects the solubility and distribution of elements in the soil.

Expectation.Question: What factors could explain the low levels of organic chlorine compounds like DDT and 666 in the 南迦巴瓦峰地区's environmental samples?
Expectation.Answer: The low levels of organic chlorine compounds could be due to the region's relatively untouched natural environment, which minimizes exposure to these pollutants, coupled with the effectiveness of natural processes that limit their accumulation and facilitate their degradation.

Judgmental.Question: What is your evaluation of the effectiveness of using different soil types at various altitudes to understand the chemical weathering processes in the 南迦巴瓦峰 region?
Judgmental.Answer: The use of different soil types at various altitudes appears to be an effective approach in understanding chemical weathering processes. The data suggests a strong relationship between soil chemistry, organic content, and altitude, indicating that lower altitudes experience more intense biological and chemical weathering. This approach provides insight into the environmental conditions and soil development processes in the region.

Judgmental.Question: How would you assess the challenges of measuring organic chlorine compounds in the 南迦巴瓦峰 environment, given their potential for long-distance migration?
Judgmental.Answer: Measuring organic chlorine compounds like DDT, 666, and PCB in the 南迦巴瓦峰 environment poses significant challenges due to their stability and potential for long-distance migration. The trace analysis methods used are crucial for understanding the low concentration levels in the region's biotic and abiotic samples, but the complexity of tracking their sources and understanding their impact remains a challenge.

Judgmental.Question: What is your perspective on the potential for expanding dataset collection methodologies to improve the understanding of atmospheric aerosols in the 南迦巴瓦峰 area?
Judgmental.Answer: Expanding dataset collection methodologies could significantly enhance understanding of atmospheric aerosols in the 南迦巴瓦峰 area. Current methods focus on measuring and analyzing aerosols at specific points, which allows for studies on their transport, diffusion, and transformation. However, incorporating more advanced technologies or expanding geographical coverage could provide a more comprehensive picture of aerosol dynamics and background atmospheric conditions.

Assertion.Question: I'm not sure how data collection methods can accurately measure the elemental content in different soil types in the Nanga Parbat region.
Assertion.Answer: The elemental content in different soil types in the Nanga Parbat region is measured by analyzing the impact of parent material and the soil type on element distribution. The study uses tables to indicate the average values and standard deviations of elements in major soil types and parent materials, suggesting a methodical approach to understanding these relationships.

Assertion.Question: I don't understand how the transport and transformation of atmospheric aerosols in the Nanga Parbat region are studied.
Assertion.Answer: Atmospheric aerosols in the Nanga Parbat region are analyzed using PIXE (Proton Induced X-ray Emission) method. This method helps in exploring the transport, diffusion, transformation, and enrichment patterns of aerosols, aiming to understand the atmospheric background values and trace the sources of pollutants.

Assertion.Question: I can't figure out how the presence of organic chlorinated compounds in the environment is detected and analyzed in this region.
Assertion.Answer: The presence of organic chlorinated compounds such as DDT, 666, and PCB in the Nanga Parbat region is detected and analyzed using trace analysis methods. These methods are applied to water, soil, plants, and animal samples to understand the biological background conditions, with findings indicating very low concentrations, generally at the 10^-8 magnitude.
